dataset.title: Michigan Department of Environmental Quality (MIDEQ), MI: Water Color Study, 2006

abstract.para: The MI-DEQ initiated this study to test the nutrient criteria model developed in the state in which water color was one of the predictor variables of lake phosphorus. Great Lakes Environmental Center (GLEC) collected samples from 24 lakes/reservoirs; MDEQ collected samples on 39 lakes; and GLEC analyzed all data in their lab.

section.title: Total Phosphorus
section.para: Method 4500-P, Seconds A, B, F; Standard Methods. 1998.

samplingDescription.para: Grab samples. Water was collected from the top meter of water over the deepest portion of the lake. One sample collected per location and were collected in late summer, no later than Aug 31, 2006. TP samples were preserved in field by addition of acid to sample bottles and kept cold. Color samples were placed in ice-filled coolers within 48 hrs.

dataTable.entityDescription: Michigan Department of Environmental Quality (MIDEQ), MI: Water Color Study, 2006

attribute.attributeDefinition: the position the water sample was taken
signifies when the sample is at detection =(LT), which for color is 7 PCU, so LT means that the value is < 7PCU
Agency responsible for collection of the data
